messages.title: Only a vote for Nick Tulloch can beat the SNP here
messages.content: Only one vote can beat the SNP here in Inverness, Nairn, Badenoch & Strathspey - a vote for Scottish Conservative and Unionist candidate Nick Tulloch. Nicola Sturgeon promised that the 2014 referendum on independence would be “once in a generation”. But she has gone back on her word and, just a few weeks ago, demanded that she hold another divisive referendum campaign.

messages.title: Nick Tulloch: Ruth Davidson's Candidate
messages.content: This area is a fantastic place to live, work and raise a family, but we have pressing issues like healthcare provision, education, transport and jobs.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We need to encourage businesses to start and develop and work with local companies to create good quality, well-paid jobs.

We need a better bus network with more frequent services. Our roads need investment - temporary pothole repairs just don’t work. In today’s world, high speed broadband and mobile coverage is an essential service.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Protect our vital local hospital and GP services
keyPolicies.policyDescription: SNP centralisation of emergency services must be reversed and brought back to where local knowledge is greatest.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Properly funded schools with better facilities
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We want schools that provide the right environment for our children to learn and to enable them to pursue sport and other activities.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Evidence is clear. The only way to bring the SNP back down to size and say no to their referendum is by voting Scottish Conservative.

issues.brexitEurope: So, unless people stand up to the SNP, we face yet more constitutional division and yet more uncertainty over our future.
issues.economy: Scottish Government from the day job they should be focussing on - tackling the crisis in our schools and the NHS.
issues.education: We want properly funded schools with better facilities. We want schools that provide the right environment for our children to learn and to enable them to pursue sport and other activities.
issues.government: Nicola Sturgeon promised that the 2014 referendum on independence would be “once in a generation”. ... Evidence is clear. The only way to bring the SNP back down to size and say no to their referendum is by voting Scottish Conservative.
issues.health: SNP centralisation of emergency services must be reversed and brought back to where local knowledge is greatest.
issues.transport: We need a better bus network with more frequent services. Our roads need investment - temporary pothole repairs just don’t work. In today’s world, high speed broadband and mobile coverage is an essential service.

community.content: We have pressing issues like healthcare provision, education, transport and jobs.

leaflet.personalStatement: As a businessman in the region, I can offer a fresh and enthusiastic approach and a wide perspective. I will always be easily accessible to you and I will hold regular surgeries throughout the area.

contactInformation.address: Nick Tulloch, Inverness, Nairn, Badenoch & Strathspey, 2 Old Bar Road, NAIRN, IV12 5BX

examples: We have pressing issues like healthcare provision, education, transport and jobs.
As a businessman in the region, I can offer a fresh and enthusiastic approach and a wide perspective. I will always be easily accessible to you and I will hold regular surgeries throughout the area.
The only way to bring the SNP back down to size and say no to their referendum is by voting Scottish Conservative.
We need a better bus network with more frequent services.
Our roads need investment - temporary pothole repairs just don’t work. In today’s world, high speed broadband and mobile coverage is an essential service.
SNP centralisation of emergency services must be reversed and brought back to where local knowledge is greatest.
Scottish Government from the day job they should be focussing on - tackling the crisis in our schools and the NHS.
